description: From Middle French contentieux, from Latin contentiōsus (“quarrelsome, perverse”), from contentiō (“contention”), from contendere, past participle contentus (“to contend”). Equivalent to English contention + -ous.

adjectives.description: contentious (comparative more contentious, superlative most contentious)

entries.meaning: Marked by heated arguments or controversy.
Given to struggling with others out of jealousy or discord.
